summary_and_description:
Window draws corrupted content when transitioning from full screen to maximized state (Linux/NVIDIA)

Tested on: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux x86_64; NVIDIA 470.182.03) Gecko/20020919

Steps to reproduce:
1) Start with window in maximized state
2) Enter full screen (F11)
3) Exit full screen (F11)

Observed Behavior:
- Window correctly returns to maximized state
- Content area shows graphical corruption:
  * Partial screen tearing
  * UI elements drawn at wrong coordinates
  * Requires manual resize to fix

Expected Behavior:
Clean rendering when exiting full screen without corruption

Technical Notes:
- Only occurs with NVIDIA proprietary drivers
- Correlates with X11 sync events (xrandr log shows timing issues)
- Distinct from state management bugs as the window state is preserved correctly - this is purely a rendering/compositing issue.
